fullProgramDescription: The Computer Engineering program at UCLA is offered through the Samueli School of Engineering. The program prepares students for a career in the rapidly growing field of computer engineering, which encompasses both hardware and software aspects. Students gain a strong foundation in computer architecture, digital design, software engineering, and other relevant areas.
shortProgramDescription: The UCLA Computer Engineering B.S. program provides a comprehensive education in computer engineering, preparing students for diverse careers or further study.
classHighlights: The program begins with foundational courses in programming (CS 31, CS 32), computer organization (ECEnigr 10), and digital logic (ECEnigr 3).
Students then progress to more specialized courses in computer architecture (ECE 115A, 115B, 115C), digital design (ECE 111, 113), and software engineering (CS 35L, CS 131).
Additional coursework includes electrical engineering (ECE 10, 11), signals and systems (ECE 102), and mathematics (Math 31A, 31B, 32A, 32B, 33A).
Students also take a range of technical electives, allowing them to explore areas such as computer networks, embedded systems, or VLSI design.
Throughout the program, students develop skills in design, analysis, and problem-solving, preparing them for a wide range of career opportunities.
Laboratory and project-based courses provide hands-on experience, complementing theoretical coursework.
Upper-division courses emphasize advanced topics and the integration of concepts learned in earlier courses.
learningOutcomes: Apply fundamental principles of computer engineering to design and analyze systems.
Understand computer architecture, digital design, and software engineering.
Use programming skills to develop software for a variety of applications.
Analyze and solve complex engineering problems.
Communicate technical concepts effectively in written and oral form.
Work effectively in teams to design and implement projects.
Stay current with emerging technologies and trends in the field.

additionalInformation: The Computer Engineering program at UCLA is a highly competitive and rigorous program that requires a strong foundation in mathematics and science. Students are encouraged to participate in research projects, internships, and other extracurricular activities to gain practical experience.
